dataQuores.text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
dataQuores.author: Plato

dataQuores.text: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
dataQuores.author: Henry Ford

dataQuores.text: I don’t care what you think about me. I don’t think about you at all.
dataQuores.author: Coco Chanel

dataQuores.text: Work hard to get what you like, otherwise you'll be forced to just like what you get.
dataQuores.author: Bernard Show

dataQuores.text: In the End, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends
dataQuores.author: Martin Luther King

dataQuores.text: When you do something noble and beautiful and nobody noticed, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle and yet most of the audience still sleeps.
dataQuores.author: John Lennon

dataQuores.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
dataQuores.author: Mahatma Gandhi

dataQuores.text: Success is the ability to go from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm.
dataQuores.author: Winston Churchill

dataQuores.text: The biggest risk is not taking any risk. In a world that's changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.
dataQuores.author: Mark Zuckerberg

dataQuores.text: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.
dataQuores.author: O. Wilde

dataQuores.text: Our life is what our thoughts make it. Наша жизнь есть то, что мы думаем о ней.
dataQuores.author: M. Aurelius

dataQuores.text: As long as man continues to be the ruthless destroyer of lower living beings he will never know health or peace. For as long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other.
dataQuores.author: Pythagoras

dataQuores.text: The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool.
dataQuores.author: R. Bradbury

dataQuores.text: If you love something set it free; if it comes back, it's yours. If it doesn't it never was.
dataQuores.author: Richard Bach

dataQuores.text: For true love is inexhaustible; the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow.
dataQuores.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

dataQuores.text: Love is a friendship set to music.
dataQuores.author: Joseph Campbell

dataQuores.text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
dataQuores.author: Confucius

dataQuores.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
dataQuores.author: Albert Einstein

dataQuores.text: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
dataQuores.author: Albert Einstein

dataQuores.text: And if you gaze long into an abyss, the abyss also gazes into you.
dataQuores.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

dataQuores.text: Only two things we'll regret on deathbed – that we are a little loved and little traveled.
dataQuores.author: Mark Twain

dataQuores.text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
dataQuores.author: Oscar Wilde

dataQuores.text: My mom always said life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get.
dataQuores.author: Forrest Gump

dataQuores.text: We buy things we don't need, to impress people we don't like.
dataQuores.author: Бойцовский клуб

dataQuores.text: And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: it is only with the heart that one can see rightly, what is essential is invisible to the eye.
dataQuores.author: The little Prince
